solution_line_template: If Rena will be {age_difference} years older than Pam in 10 years, this means they have a {age_difference} year age gap.
Therefore, to be twice Pam's age, Rena would have to be {age_difference}*{multiplier_twice}=<<{age_difference}*{multiplier_twice}={rena_current_age}>>{rena_current_age} years old.
This means that Pam is currently {rena_current_age}-{age_difference}= <<{rena_current_age}-{age_difference}={pam_current_age}>>{pam_current_age} years old.
